author: vladimirp
title: Incentivize the Testnet
description: How can we encourage old and new stakepool operators on the Testnet to run their pools for the benefit of Cardano in the next six months?

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would be a great idea and meet the challenge goal, and I think that proposal is urgently needed for the Cardano Community, because it allow important projects to better simulate real world conditions on the testnet.
However the objective of the proposal is real and urgent, and I think it's important to for the challenge and I suggest to define use cases to pay stakepool operators for their time devoted to the Testnet.
f6_assessments.q1:
I think that it’s important to define incentivize testnet like in other blockchain community, so we need to explore new ways of incentivizing testnet players to grow the Cardano ecosystem.
In my opinion Cardano Community is a great place to develop new brilliant ideas and this challenge surely involve many SPO’s, developers and Dex to propose new incentivize models and I hope that ADA holders have the possibilities to vote for the best proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
Success criteria is simple to identify and trace with key metrics to measure (eg. Number of SPOs benefiting from running a pool on Testnet, number of pool alive h24 in the last year, …) .
I think that the successes and metrics are easly verifiable through the documents and future CIPs which will eventually be created through funding.
The budget allocated for the challenge is right and correct aligned with the possibile proposals.

f6_assessments.q0: Right now, the testnet is far removed from ordinary developers who are not experts in blockchain and the Cardano infrastructure. Making it easier to use the testnet will be a game changer allowing people to educate themselves and others by running stake pools and deploying smart contracts in a much easier (compared to now) and completely safe (compared to mainnet) environment. I believe that this is the single most important category proposed this fund for next fund and fully agree that it is critical to achieve the mission (of Catalyst for) Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The key metrics and roadmap concentrate heavily on SPO but it is credible that with some additional directions this challenge can be a huge success with relatively low budget projects achieving outsized gains in improvements for Cardano developers, existing and would-be. Members already onboarded to project Catalyst and funded proposers likely to propose again have the skills to create great solutions in this challenge that would carry enormous benefit for a wide range of applications.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget and metrics align very well with the description of the challenge and my understanding how impact can be delivered. The challenge team should have the ability to guide proposers meaningfully, and the coherence and well-defined scope of the challenge appear to be verifiable and realistic. I have no reservations about the transparency and lack of conflict of interest from the side of the challenge proposers or that any untoward agendas are targeted. In summary, everything looks good and correctly set to measure progress and onboard, mentor and de-brief proposers throughout their Catalyst challenge if this challenge will be included in Fund-9.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge is very crucial for the Cardano ecosystem and especially for future solutions developers. As we grow larger, it becomes more critical to have a testnet that is robust enough to simulate manner, especially for big projects like identity solutions and microtransactions...
f6_assessments.q1: The catalyst community definitely has the ability to address such issues especially the catalyst itself is an incentives-based solution. Hence, one can see that we have enough innovators to solve such problems and move forward.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics and measures presented in this challenge are very interesting since they represent what the community would like to see in maninet as well. For instance, some of the metrics are geographical location diversity and type of SPO diversity (bare metal, centralized servers...) which is something we see the community striving to achieve every day in order to insure decentralization.

f6_assessments.q0:
The cardano ecosystem is in constant development. With further upgrades needed to scale globally. The testnet is a major test area and has seen a drop in activity and support. 
Some minor peaks when large WEB3 projects were testing and quickly dropping back down. 
The proposals topic to incentivise the testnet is crucial for cardano's mission. In addition part of the great success of the first SPO's was to participate at the ITN that was brought up for the first POS decentrilse network launch of cardano. I feel it is important to support such project and will have an impact on the continued progress and improvement of cardano space.
f6_assessments.q1:
I am part of the Testnet SPO running a testnet pool. And have seen that large activity of new commers in the space. I feel the catalyst community and cardano will always have newcomers. One of the first steps a newcomer in the SPO space is to launch a testnet pool and run tests. 
The space is continually seeing growth and requires support from a catalyst project to propose incetivisation of the Testnet. 
In addition the developpers of cardano from IOHK and other decntralized web3 projects on cardano are always requesting further interaction in the tesnte space. 
There is a need to keep the activity on the testnet blockchain and high level of active pools to ensure the testing of the projects and cardano improvement are properly vetted before launching on mainnet.
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditting in the testnet space is very simple as the same factors that run the mainnet are in place to audit on testnet. The blockchain is verifiable and all the improivement browught forward are tracebale. 
SPO on testnet can demonstrate their actiivty and receive incentivisatoin.,

importance: Cardano Testnet gives SPOs, Dexs and smart contract developers the opportunity to actively test core Cardano functionality before Mainnet
success: A healthier, livelier, more participatory and better used Testnet that is evolving and improving while ensuring vibrant SPO interest
